intro: Crypsinus daweishanensis, commonly known as the Daweishan crypts, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments, typically found in dense forests. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are typically white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
